Class BaseModel

java.lang.Object
com.davidgable.jstruct.BaseModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExampleMain, ExampleUser
public abstract class BaseModel extends Object
Base class for all jstruct data models.

BaseModel provides common functionality for structured data objects, including standardized string representation and JSON serialization support. User-defined models should extend this class to inherit default behavior and integration with the jstruct serialization pipeline.

It comes with serialization/deserialization (using Jackson) and data validation (using Jakarta). When using deserializing a model, BaseModel.modelValidate() is run to validate data fields to check for constraint violations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
David Gable

    • modelDumpJson

      public String modelDumpJson(int indent) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Get a JSON string for the object
      Parameters:
      indent - an int that sets how many spaces to indent with (adds newlines and spaces if greater than to 0)
      Returns:
      a String with indents (if specified)
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if unable to write the object to a JSON string

    • modelDumpWrite

      public boolean modelDumpWrite(String filename, int indent)
      Serializes an object to a filename
      Parameters:
      filename - a String for where the object should be serialized
      indent - an int that sets how many spaces to indent with (adds newlines and spaces if greater than to 0)
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying if serialization was successful

    • modelDumpWrite

      Parameters:

      indent - an int that sets how many spaces to indent with (adds newlines and spaces if greater than to 0)
      Returns:
      a boolean specifying if serialization was successful

    • modelValidate

      public <T extends BaseModel> T modelValidate(String filename, Class<T> type) throws IOException
      Deserializes a JSON file into an object of the specified type from a Path string. Validates data fields to check for constraint violations.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type to deserialize into
      Parameters:
      filename - a String object representing the path to the JSON file
      type - a Class<T> object representing the type to deserialize into
      Returns:
      an object of type T deserialized from the JSON file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist, cannot be read, or deserialization fails
      IllegalStateException - if the validation fails for any reason.

    • modelValidate

      public <T extends BaseModel> T modelValidate(Path filename, Class<T> type) throws IOException
      Deserializes a JSON file into an object of the specified type from a Path. Validates data fields to check for constraint violations.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type to deserialize into
      Parameters:
      filename - a Path object representing the path to the JSON file
      type - a Class<T> object representing the type to deserialize into
      Returns:
      an object of type T deserialized from the JSON file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist, cannot be read, or deserialization fails
      IllegalStateException - if the validation fails for any reason.

    • modelValidateJson

      public <T extends BaseModel> T modelValidateJson(String jsonString, Class<T> type) throws IOException
      Deserializes a JSON file into an object of the specified type from a string. Validates data fields to check for constraint violations.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type to deserialize into
      Parameters:
      jsonString - a String object representing the content of a JSON file
      type - a Class<T> object representing the type to deserialize into
      Returns:
      an object of type T deserialized from the JSON file
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist, cannot be read, or deserialization fails
      IllegalStateException - if the validation fails for any reason.
